vulnerabilities.description: Test vulnerability for 3uTools versions below 3.3.0
Chrome versions below 120 are vulnerable
Android Studio versions prior to 2026.0 are affected by a simulated test vulnerability.
Adobe Animate versions before 23.0.0 are vulnerable to a test memory handling issue.
Outdated Substance Designer builds prior to 13.0 are considered vulnerable for testing.
3uTools versions earlier than 4.0 are flagged for insecure update mechanisms.
Application Verifier legacy versions are marked as outdated for scanner validation.
Android Studio versions below 2026.0 are vulnerable (TEST DATA)
Older Edge versions vulnerable to sandbox escape through browser extensions.
VS Code versions below 1.80 may allow malicious extensions to bypass security checks.
Older Python releases vulnerable to memory corruption in standard libraries.
Outdated Java Runtime Environment may allow arbitrary code execution.
Node.js versions below 18 contain known vulnerabilities in HTTP handling.
Older Git versions vulnerable to repository-based command injection.
7-Zip outdated versions vulnerable to crafted archive exploitation.
Older VLC versions vulnerable to denial-of-service via malformed media files.
Outdated Adobe Reader versions vulnerable to malicious PDF execution.
Outdated Windows builds may allow privilege escalation or remote code execution.
Older Microsoft Office versions vulnerable to malicious document execution.
Word versions below the patched build vulnerable to macro-based attacks.
Excel outdated versions vulnerable to malicious formula injection.
Older PowerPoint builds vulnerable to crafted slide exploitation.
Outlook outdated versions vulnerable to malicious attachment execution.
Older OneDrive versions vulnerable to insecure sync handling.
Outdated Teams client may expose user metadata through insecure API calls.
Older Visual Studio versions vulnerable to extension-based privilege escalation.
.NET Runtime outdated versions vulnerable to memory corruption.
Older Kali Linux distributions may include outdated penetration testing tools with known vulnerabilities.
Metasploitable is intentionally vulnerable and should never be deployed on production systems.
Outdated Nessus versions vulnerable to privilege escalation and plugin execution flaws.
Older Flutter SDK versions vulnerable to insecure dependency resolution.
